intro: Trichocereus chiloensis, commonly known as the Chiloé cactus, is a species of cactus native to Chile. It is characterized by its columnar stems that are often ribbed and covered with spines. The plant produces striking white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
